longInfo:
Passport required.
- Nationals of the France are allowed to enter with an expired
  passport. The passport is accepted when expired for a
  maximum of 5 years. 
- Nationals of France traveling without a passport must have a
  document accepted for entry, valid on arrival. 
- Nationals of France are allowed to enter with expired (max.
  5 years) National ID Cards issued  
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a National ID Card issued to nationals of France.
  
- Holders of a National ID Card issued to nationals of New
  Caledonia. 

VISA NOT REQUIRED.

Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of New Caledonia will be
  expected to hold their own passport or National ID Card
  (where applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia,
  Cyprus, Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
- All minors who are nationals of New Caledonia are expected
  to hold their own travel document
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving in
Guadeloupe or Martinique within 6 days after leaving or
transiting countries with risk of yellow fever transmission
For details, click here. 

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 1 year of age.
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission provided not leaving the transit areas.
